title: The Commoditization of Services
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-21, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.excel.holdings%2Fp%2Fthe-commoditization-of-services%3Futm_source=tldrfounders/1/0100019be0bf2f25-13596937-b469-48eb-b4f4-2bf31a5256e0-000000/XZuAzGO4KL9JVGr16RocsexRgq11lrC35HTM0GApeF8=441
summary: The Commoditization of Services (5 minute read) Before electrification, light was scarce and expensive. When it became cheap, people stopped thinking about the cost of turning on a switch. If the cost of production drops to near zero, price must follow.

title: The Tragedy of the Agentic Commons
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-21, Reading time: 14 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.strangeloopcanon.com%2Fp%2Fthe-tragedy-of-the-agentic-commons%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019be0ebe674-5bcffab8-988b-4fa2-b449-f3944f7988cc-000000/vbyNDukx7lnThXeDecwYo-XA545Rn33VN1UFDtsTiio=441
summary: The Tragedy of the Agentic Commons (14 minute read) AI agents can improve matching markets, like dating or job searches, by using LLMs to convert unstructured preferences into actionable data, outperforming standard questionnaires. However, in markets where everyone uses AI agents, congestion increases significantly, reducing efficiency without a pricing mechanism. Introducing prices and institutional design can alleviate congestion, streamline coordination, and enhance market efficiency.

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fhackernoon.com%2Fa-deep-dive-into-seatunnel-metadata-caching%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019be5640b3a-97a12639-0eb4-416a-a638-2131a44ac10c-000000/mQ3LTefabu2aG4l8se8FsKw0goVn3F5wYNwdkuqXKQM=441
summary: A Deep Dive Into SeaTunnel Metadata Caching (5 minute read) SeaTunnel Zeta addresses the major data integration bottlenecks of classloader conflicts, checkpoint overhead, and metadata request surges via intelligent metadata caching, distributed Hazelcast's IMap storage, and automated lifecycle management. Its shared classloader model reduces Metaspace use, while millisecond-level state access and asynchronous persistence decouple memory and backup, ensuring reliability in large-scale jobs.

title: Unconventional PostgreSQL Optimizations
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 11 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fhakibenita.com%2Fpostgresql-unconventional-optimizations%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019be5640b3a-97a12639-0eb4-416a-a638-2131a44ac10c-000000/XlWqJcZBFIILM_gCLdQHPDbI84OiZIDbaNIX__-rK90=441
summary: Unconventional PostgreSQL Optimizations (11 minute read) Unconventional PostgreSQL techniques can deliver big performance gains, such as skipping impossible scans using constraints, indexing only the expressions you actually query to shrink indexes, and enforcing uniqueness on large values with hash-backed constraints. Thoughtful schema and index design often beats the default habit of adding large B-tree indexes everywhere.

title: Prisma 7: Rust-Free Architecture and Performance Gains
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.infoq.com%2Fnews%2F2026%2F01%2Fprisma-7-performance%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019be5640b3a-97a12639-0eb4-416a-a638-2131a44ac10c-000000/btbULTBLJt7vYwIFu1s1-KvdEwyRu3_wcKM4IaiE8i0=441
summary: Prisma 7: Rust-Free Architecture and Performance Gains (3 minute read) Prisma, the TypeScript-first ORM, shifts away from Rust in its release 7.0, delivering a 90% reduction in bundle size and 3x faster query execution, while cutting CPU and memory loads. Generated code now resides outside node_modules, enabling faster, restart-free development workflows, and type generation is 70% quicker, evaluating 98% fewer types.

summary: Apple Developing AirTag-Sized AI Pin With Dual Cameras (2 minute read) Apple is reportedly working on a small, wearable AI pin equipped with multiple cameras, a speaker, and microphones. title: Similarity Scores Are Not Enough For Matching
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.usetusk.ai%2Fresources%2Fsimilarity-scores-are-not-enough-for-matching%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019be59bb3fe-fdc5bab6-3ab9-43dc-b96b-cf0f94e7a428-000000/ovSsI4mSQCbrCVw9B2qY-h_WEWgxr8cWqUIJnFw18D4=439
summary: Similarity Scores Are Not Enough For Matching (7 minute read) Tusk found traditional similarity scoring insufficient for accurate matching in Tusk Drift, a CLI tool for test generation and matching. Instead, its team developed a system based on a prioritized cascade of constraints to eliminate obviously incorrect matches first. Similarity scoring is then only used as a tiebreaker for the small percentage of requests that pass initial constraint.

title: Can you slim macOS down?
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 6 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Feclecticlight.co%2F2026%2F01%2F21%2Fcan-you-slim-macos-down%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019be59bb3fe-fdc5bab6-3ab9-43dc-b96b-cf0f94e7a428-000000/oWi8ku6qmb2QypmgGXgVA7NTCQw_zyk5NCTAgHyERIQ=439
summary: Can you slim macOS down? (6 minute read) macOS can be "slimmed down" by disabling its hundreds of background processes. However, identifying and safely modifying these numerous, interrelated, and constantly changing processes is practically impossible, especially as most are located within the unalterable Signed System Volume. For example, even when Time Machine is disabled, its processes are still scheduled and dispatched by inaccessible system services.

title: SDFlgs - The Log Field I'd Been Ignoring That Unlocked Attack Path Detection
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-22, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.huntress.com%2Fblog%2Fldap-active-directory-detection-part-three%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019be619f6bb-d58c16ae-c07d-4029-84c5-a5571612f3dc-000000/gbzvY47fnez-2Y0h-THFsjLlZYwDJTfQUt70WUyQpQE=441
summary: SDFlgs - The Log Field I'd Been Ignoring That Unlocked Attack Path Detection (8 minute read) SDFlags is a field that controls which security descriptor information is returned in queries and is used extensively in BloodHound and SharpHound. Querying for nTSecurityDescriptor fields (Owner, Group, DACL, or SACL) opens the door to attack path mapping. Conversely, legitimate tools almost never set SDFlags when running AD queries, opening up a new detection opportunity.

summary: GenAI, The Snake Eating Its Own Tail (11 minute read) AI weakens the ecosystems it relies on. Models trained on human content extract value without attribution or revenue for creators. A proposed fix is pay-per-use AI, with source citations and revenue sharing, so creators, users, and AI companies all benefit.

title: How Binary Dependencies Work Across Different Languages
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-23, Reading time: 13 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fvlad.website%2Fhow-binary-dependencies-work%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019bead24678-cc5db18d-2a26-4123-83e1-84f2d9c282b0-000000/zBGPFifr_-U1OHHa93g6dEBe-ly0uwYGazgexUngq4Y=441
summary: How Binary Dependencies Work Across Different Languages (13 minute read) Precompiled binary libraries can be called from higher-level languages through three main approaches: dynamic linking, dynamic loading via FFI, and dynamic linking using extension modules. These techniques differ in when symbol resolution happens and how data is converted, with extension modules offering the best performance and flexibility at the cost of more complex native code.

summary: Against cleverness (11 minute read) As AI and other complex technologies spread, good design must focus on resilience, transparency, and recovery rather than blaming individuals or chasing peak performance. AI amplifies latent errors, deskills humans, and fails unpredictably, so systems should limit autonomy, preserve human accountability, define clear boundaries, and be designed to fail safelyâ€”aiming not for smarter systems, but wiser ones that understand their limits.

title: The Invisible Work
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-23, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fhvpandya.com%2Finvisible-work%3Futm_source=tldrdesign/1/0100019beb042bca-e83e8e8c-00ef-4ce4-a1cb-f741abefe227-000000/p6DSQZ7GfoP1yHDHeR8jQK8q5vhmfkoEuME9wEjAEp4=441
summary: The Invisible Work (8 minute read) The most important work in organizations is often invisible: the coordination, clarification, and judgment that keep projects from drifting into chaos but disappear once things run smoothly. Recognition follows visible outputs and simple narratives, so this quiet leadership is undervalued, making it crucial for people who do it to work under leaders who can recognize and protect the work that actually makes progress possible.

Authentication and authorization in Model Context Protocol (13 minute read) Remote MCP servers should implement the OAuth 2.1 Authorization Code grant with PKCE for client authentication, leveraging protected resource metadata (RFC 9728) and authorization server discovery (RFC 8414) for the handshake.
